param.name: zero_method
param.label: pratt,wilcox,zsplit
param.option: Pratt treatment: includes zero-differences in the ranking process
Zero rank split: just like Pratt, but spliting the zero rank between positive and negative ones

param.name: center
param.label: Which function of the data to use in the test

param.name: interpolation
param.label: this specifies the interpolation method to use, when the desired quantile lies between two data points i and j

param.name: ties
param.label: Determines how values equal to the grand median are classified in the contingency table

param.name: dist
param.label: the type of distribution to test against. The default is ‘norm’ and ‘extreme1’ is a synonym for ‘gumbel’

param.name: kind
param.label: This optional parameter specifies the interpretation of the resulting score

param.name: md
param.label: The method used to assign ranks to tied elements

param.name: mode
param.label: Defines the distribution used for calculating the p-value

param.name: interpolation
param.label: this specifies the interpolation method to use, when the desired quantile lies between two data points i and j

param.name: correction
param.label: If True, and the degrees of freedom is 1, apply Yates’ correction for continuity.

param.name: printextras
param.label: printextras
param.help: If True, if there are extra points a warning is raised saying how many of those points there are

param.name: initial_lexsort
param.label: Whether to use lexsort or quicksort as the sorting method for the initial sort of the inputs

param.name: cdf
param.label: If a string, it should be the name of a distribution in scipy.stats

param.name: ni
param.label: N
param.help: Sample size if rvs is string or callable.

param.name: mwu_use_continuity
param.label: Enable continuity correction
param.help: Whether a continuity correction (1/2.) should be taken into account.

param.name: equal_var
param.label: assume equal population
param.help: If set perform a standard independent 2 sample test that assumes equal population variances. If not set, perform Welch’s t-test, which does not assume equal population variance.

param.name: base
param.label: base
param.help: The logarithmic base to use, defaults to e

param.name: med
param.label: Name of method to use to combine p-values

param.name: reta
param.label: Whether or not to return the internally computed a values.
param.help: Whether or not to return the internally computed a values

param.name: n
param.label: the number of trials
param.help: This is ignored if x gives both the number of successes and failures

param.name: n
param.label: moment
param.help: order of central moment that is returned

param.name: equal_var
param.label: assume equal population
param.help: If set perform a standard independent 2 sample test that assumes equal population variances. If not set, perform Welch’s t-test, which does not assume equal population variance.

param.name: imbda
param.label: imbda
param.help: do the transformation for that value

param.name: ddof
param.label: ddof
param.help: Degrees of freedom correction for standard deviation.

param.name: dtype
param.label: Type of the returned array and of the accumulator in which the elements are summed

param.name: m
param.label: low
param.help: Lower bound factor of sigma clipping. Default is 4.

param.name: mf
param.label: lower_limit
param.help: lower values for the range of the histogram

param.name: nf
param.label: upper_limit
param.help: higher values for the range of the histogram

param.name: b
param.label: numbins
param.help: The number of bins to use for the histogram

param.name: proportiontocut
param.label: proportiontocut
param.help: Proportion (in range 0-1) of total data set to trim of each end

param.name: alpha
param.label: alpha
param.help: Probability that the returned confidence interval contains the true parameter

param.name: score
param.label: score
param.help: Score that is compared to the elements in a

param.name: axis
param.label: 0 means one-dimensional array
param.help: Axis along which the kurtosis is calculated

param.name: new
param.label: newval
param.help: Value to put in place of values in a outside of bounds

param.name: fisher
param.label: Fisher’s definition is used
param.help: If True, Fisher’s definition is used (normal ==> 0.0). If False, Pearson’s definition is used (normal ==> 3.0).

param.name: b
param.label: numbins
param.help: The number of bins to use for the histogram

param.name: proportiontocut
param.label: proportiontocut
param.help: Proportion (in range 0-1) of total data set to trim of each end

param.name: bias
param.label: bias
param.help: If False, then the calculations are corrected for statistical bias.

param.name: lambda_
param.label: lambda_
param.help: lambda_ gives the power in the Cressie-Read power divergence statistic.

param.name: inclusive
param.label: flag
param.help: These flags determine whether values exactly equal to the lower or upper limits are included

param.name: inclusive1
param.label: lower flag
param.help: These flags determine whether values exactly equal to the lower or upper limits are included

param.name: inclusive2
param.label: upper flag
param.help: These flags determine whether values exactly equal to the lower or upper limits are included

param.name: inclusive
param.label: flag
param.help: These flags determine whether values exactly equal to the lower or upper limits are included
